title: 111_hr3923
content: The Act is titled the "Sugar Loaf Fire Protection District Land Exchange Act" and includes definitions for various terms. The Act, titled the "Sugar Loaf Fire Protection District Land Exchange Act," defines terms such as District, Federal land, and National Forest, specifically referring to parcels of land in the Arapaho-Roosevelt National Forest in Colorado. The Arapaho-Roosevelt National Forests in Colorado include approximately 5.17 acres of non-Federal land in Boulder County, as depicted on a map dated November 12, 2009. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Agriculture. SEC. 3. LAND EXCHANGE. The District can offer to convey non-Federal land to the Secretary, who will then convey Federal land to the District. The land exchange is subject to the provisions of the Act and follows applicable laws, with the Secretary able to accept cash payments exceeding 25% of the Federal land value. The District will pay for land surveys and appraisals, allocate administrative costs with the Secretary, and comply with additional terms and conditions for the land exchange. The exchange must be completed within 1 year of the Act's enactment. The Secretary has the authority to conduct the sale of Federal land. If the land exchange is not completed within 1 year, the Secretary can offer to sell the Federal land to the District for fair market value. Proceeds from any cash payments or sales will be deposited into a specific fund established by Public Law 90-171 for future use. The Secretary can use deposited funds for land acquisition in the National Forest without further appropriation. Acquired non-Federal land will be added to the National Forest and managed according to specific laws and regulations. Public orders withdrawing Federal land can be revoked. The Federal land is revoked to allow conveyance to the District, and is withdrawn until the conveyance is completed. The Federal land is revoked for conveyance to the District, withdrawn until completion. Passed by the House of Representatives on July 13, 2010.
